wikipedia_page.main: Courtenay Foote (22 November 1878 – 4 May 1925) was an English stage and silent film actor. He appeared with George Arliss on stage in 1911 in the long running play Disraeli. He appeared in 59 films between 1910 and 1924. He was born in Harrogate, West Riding of Yorkshire and died in Italy.
